chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: In this video, we will see how to add CSS to an HTML page.

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: There are 3 ways to add CSS to HTML.

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: The first way is inline CSS which is used as a style attribute

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: and added to HTML pages.

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: The second way is internal CSS.

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: Internal CSS means that you put a style tag

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: and put the CSS of that HTML in the style tag of the HTML page.

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: And after that, the most used is external CSS.

chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS
chunks.text: Make a .css file and put all your styles in that .css file.

chunks.text: which one should be used and which one should be avoided.
